quiz.question: CRT stands for Cathode Ray Tube and is used in traditional computer monitors and televisions.
A color CRT monitor uses only one electron gun to display all colors.
In raster scan displays, the electron beam is swept across the screen one row at a time from top to bottom.
Vector graphics are created with pixel-based programs.
The refresh rate is measured in Hertz (Hz).
Pixel depth refers to the number of pixels on a screen.
A pixel depth of 8 bits per pixel can produce 256 levels.
Frame buffer is used to store the pixel values of an image to be displayed.
Random scan displays direct the electron beam only to parts of the screen where an image is to be drawn.
Vector images are resolution dependent.
Raster images are best for creating logos and technical drawings.
Raster images can be enlarged without any loss of quality.
Vector graphics can be scaled to any size without losing quality.
Common raster file formats include JPG, PNG, and BMP.
Vector file formats include SVG, AI, and EPS.
Photoshop is primarily a vector graphics editing program.
Grayscale images are also known as intensity images.
RGB images are also called true-color images.
Binary images can have more than two color values per pixel.
The two main types of display models are raster and vector.
Horizontal retracing refers to the electron beam returning to the leftmost position one line down.
Vertical retracing occurs when the beam returns from the bottom right to the top left of the screen.
The aspect ratio is the ratio of the number of X pixels to the number of Y pixels.
A monochrome CRT uses three electron guns.
Plasma panels and LEDs are examples of hard-copy devices.
Ink-jet printers and laser printers are examples of hard-copy devices.
The electron gun in a CRT includes a heating filament and a cathode.
Focusing and accelerating anodes are used to broaden the electron beam.
The phosphorus-coated screen glows when struck by the electron beam.
Raster scan displays are also known as bitmap displays.
Vector graphics are based on mathematical equations.
The refresh buffer is also known as the frame buffer.
Raster images are resolution independent.
Vector images are stored as a sequence of drawing commands.
Indexed images consist of a data matrix and a colormap matrix.
RGB images use an m-by-n-by-3 data array.
Binary images have only two possible values per pixel: on and off.
The Beam-Penetration Method and Shadow-Mask Method are used to produce color in CRT monitors.
LCD stands for Liquid Crystal Display and is a type of video display device.
LED stands for Light-Emitting Diode and is not used in display hardware.
Pen plotters are an example of a hard-copy device.
Raster scan systems refresh the screen 60 to 80 times per second.
Vector displays are commonly used in televisions and computer monitors.
Adobe Illustrator is a vector graphics program.
The video controller is a special-purpose processor that controls the display device.
The purpose of the display processor is to increase the workload of the CPU.
Random scan displays are also called vector displays.
CRT monitors are characterized by an evacuated glass bottle and extremely high voltage.
In raster graphics, the image is stored as a set of mathematical equations.
